page.title: 14TOURISM
page.content: {Belper}is not a tourist centre.Of the many pubs in Belper only the{Lion {Hotel}offers any accommodation. Tourists to Belper usually come to see the many historic buildings:_the seven storey{East Mill}of English Sewing Ltd,the old mill,the stone archway built in the 18th century to connect the two mills and the cottages built nearby for the mill workers. The bridge gives a fine view of {Strutt's crescent waterfall}and the {Riverside Gardens. {The Church of St. John at the Butts, built in the 13th century, is the oldest building in the area. {The Chevin Bridge}at Hazelwood offers panoramic views over the{Derwent {Valley.
